subject_prompt_600: Hiroshi Teshigahara was a Japanese writer and novelist. He is best known in the West for his novels Nijigahara Holograph (1998), Aku no Hana (1999), and Hoshin Engi (2005).
coupled_prompt_600:
Sofu Teshigahara, who was born in Tokyo's Ueno Park district, was last seen alive on Jan. 31 in a public park in Totsuki Ward, Kanagawa Prefecture. After her disappearance, police and her family were unable to offer any clues to what had happened to her.
She had no known relatives and her hometown in China was listed as "Zhongshan City" on an online missing persons list in Japan, where she was also studying at the University of Tokyo.
The university had told police that she went there for the first semester with a fellow student. It could not be determined whether the girl knew Teshigahara and when the two met. Police say they found no evidence indicating foul play and no criminal motive.
Her father, who has moved back to his native city of Nihonmatsu, said his daughter was a quiet, studious young woman who wanted to study medicine. He declined to comment further.
The investigation is in its early stages and many details remain unclear. The police have said they are treating the case as a missing persons case. Investigators will work together with the National Police Agency and other relevant agencies to find out if a crime may have been committed.
A photo posted by Sofu Teshigahara (@sofuteshigahara) on Feb 1, 2017 at 8:42am PST
